Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) Account Request System

The Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) Account Request System is designed to facilitate the process for NIH Intramural Investigators and Extramural Scientific Staff to obtain appropriate account credentials, which will allow them to apply for access to controlled-tier level genomic data through dbGaP.

  • NIH Intramural Investigators must be at a level of tenure-track investigators, senior investigators, senior scientists, senior clinicians, or staff scientists.
  • NIH Extramural Scientific Staff must have administrative responsibility for the data; have substantial research involvement in the award that generated the data; or need access to carry out research unrelated to their portfolio management responsibilities.

For information on the Minimum Qualifications to apply to access data in dbGaP, visit https://cbiit.cancer.gov/genomic-data-access.

In order to obtain a dbGaP account to apply for controlled-access data, your Direct Supervisor and Signing Official must review and approve your request. The status of your dbGaP account request is displayed below. To view your request and additional comments, select “View”. To cancel your request for a dbGaP account, select “Withdraw”.

For more information about the Data access process, please visit https://cbiit.cancer.gov/genomic-data-access.
